Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rabbi Yossi Blesofsky, Rabbi Blesofsky serves as the spiritual leader of Chabad Lubavitch of Northeast Queens located at 212-12 26th Avenue, Bayside, New York 11360.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Vallone.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Yossi Blesofsky, serving as spirtual leader of Chabad Lubavitch of Northwast Queens located at 212-12 26th Avenue, Bayside, New York 11360.

Council Member Vallone moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting of workers’ compensation data
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Reporting of workers’ compensation data.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to health insurance benefits for surviving family members of certain deceased employees of the department of sanitation
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Health insurance benefits for surviving family members of certain deceased employees of the dept of sanitation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to health insurance coverage for surviving family members of certain deceased employees of the department of transportation
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Health insurance coverage for surviving family members of certain deceased employees of the dept of transportation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Employees’ Retirement System to determine that members are disabled for purposes of disability pensions, if the New York State Workers’ Compensation Board determines that a member has a permanent partial disability, and the U.S. Social Security Administration determines that a member is disabled for substantial gainful (work) activity, and approved for social security disability benefits
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: NYCERS tto determine that members are disabled for purposes of disability pensions, if the NYS Workers’ Compensation Board determines that a member has a permanent partial disability, and the U.S. Social Security Administration determines that a member is

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Education
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON EDUCATION

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to provide district-level data regarding compliance rates for students’ individualized education programs
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to provide district-level data regarding compliance rates for students’ individualized education programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report quarterly on compliance with students’ individual education programs and to expand the services on which the department is required to annually report
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to report quarterly on compliance with students’ individual education programs and to expand the services on which the department is required to annually report.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the department of education to annually report on certain claims for payment for tuition or services
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to annually report on certain claims for payment for tuition or services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring reports on preschool special education and early intervention services
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring reports on preschool special education and early intervention services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to establish a chief compliance officer position to ensure compliance with Individualized Education Programs and other requirements for students in special education.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: DOE to establish a chief compliance officer position to ensure compliance with Individualized Education Programs and other requirements for students in special education.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo). 

There were 43 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.
The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned to meet again for the Charter Meeting on Wednesday, January 8, 2020.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Transfer City funds between various agencies in Fiscal Year 2020 to implement changes to the City's expense budget, pursuant to Section 107(b) of the New York City Charter (MN-1).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in Fiscal Year 2020 to implement changes to the City's expense budget, pursuant to Section 107(b) of the New York City Charter (MN-1).

Items.Title: Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Appropriation of new City revenues in Fiscal Year 2020, pursuant to Section 107(e) of the New York City Charter (MN-2).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Appropriation of new City revenues in Fiscal Year 2020, pursuant to Section 107(e) of the New York City Charter (MN-2).

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Modification of the Fiscal Year 2020 Capital Budget and Capital Program proposed by the Mayor pursuant to Section 2016 of the New York City Charter.
